Author: Mark Twain
Quote: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.

Author: Jimi Hendrix,  Jimi Hendrix - Axis: Bold as Love
Quote: I'm the one that's got to die when it's time for me to die, so let me live my life the way I want to.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Fellowship of the Ring
Quote: I wish it need not have happened in my time,"said Frodo."So do I,"said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.

Author: Mitch Albom,  Tuesdays with Morrie
Quote: Death ends a life, not a relationship.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
Quote: Death's got an Invisibility Cloak?"Harry interrupted again."So he can sneak up on people,"said Ron. "Sometimes he gets bored of running at them, flapping his arms and shrieking...

Author: Antonio Porchia
Quote: One lives in the hope of becoming a memory.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  The Last Continent
Quote: It is said that your life flashes before your eyes just before you die. That is true, it's called Life.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Fight Club
Quote: I don't want to die without any scars.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: Unbeing dead isn't being alive.

Author: Langston Hughes,  The Collected Poems
Quote: Life is for the living.Death is for the dead.Let life be like music. And death a note unsaid.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: I do not fear death. I had been dead for billions and billions of years before I was born, and had not suffered the slightest inconvenience from it.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet (Shakespeare Collection)
Quote: When he shall die,Take him and cut him out in little stars,And he will make the face of heaven so fineThat all the world will be in love with nightAnd pay no worship to the garish sun.

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: It kills me sometimes, how people die.

Author: Charles Bukowski
Quote: My dear,Find what you love and let it kill you.Let it drain you of your all. Let it cling onto your back and weigh you down into eventual nothingness.Let it kill you and let it devour your remains.For all things will kill you, both slowly and fastly, but it’s much better to be killed by a lover.~ Falsely yours

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Nineteen Minutes
Quote: If you gave someone your heart and they died, did they take it with them? Did you spend the rest of forever with a hole inside you that couldn't be filled?

Author: Sarah Dessen,  The Truth About Forever
Quote: That was the thing. You never got used to it, the idea of someone being gone. Just when you think it's reconciled, accepted, someone points it out to you, and it just hits you all over again, that shocking.

Author: Hunter S. Thompson,  The Proud Highway: Saga of a Desperate Southern Gentleman, 1955-1967
Quote: Life should not be a journey to the grave with the intention of arriving safely in a pretty and well preserved body, but rather to skid in broadside in a cloud of smoke, thoroughly used up, totally worn out, and loudly proclaiming "Wow! What a Ride!

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
Quote: You'll stay with me?'Until the very end,' said James.

Author: François Rabelais
Quote: I go to seek a Great Perhaps.

Author: François Rabelais
Quote: I go to seek a Great Perhaps.

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: Even death has a heart.

Author: Norman Cousins
Quote: Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside us while we live.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
Quote: Things we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end, if not always in the way we expect.

Author: Laurie Halse Anderson,  Speak
Quote: When people don't express themselves, they die one piece at a time.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Battle of the Labyrinth
Quote: Don't feel bad, I'm usually about to die.

Author: Herbert Hoover
Quote: Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  My Sister's Keeper
Quote: If you have a sister and she dies, do you stop saying you have one? Or are you always a sister, even when the other half of the equation is gone?

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Sourcery
Quote: I meant,"said Ipslore bitterly, "what is there in this world that truly makes living worthwhile?"Death thought about it.CATS, he said eventually. CATS ARE NICE.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Invisible Monsters
Quote: If death meant just leaving the stage long enough to change costume and come back as a new character...Would you slow down? Or speed up?

Author: Ayn Rand,  The Fountainhead
Quote: I could die for you. But I couldn't, and wouldn't, live for you.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Survivor
Quote: A girl calls and asks, "Does it hurt very much to die?""Well, sweetheart,"I tell her, "yes, but it hurts a lot more to keep living.

Author: Ian Fleming,  You Only Live Twice
Quote: You only live twice:Once when you are bornAnd once when you look death in the face

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Good Omens: The Nice and Accurate Prophecies of Agnes Nutter, Witch
Quote: DON'T THINK OF IT AS DYING, said Death. JUST THINK OF IT AS LEAVING EARLY TO AVOID THE RUSH.

Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska
Quote: I found myself thinking about President William McKinley, the third American president to be assassinated. He lived for several days after he was shot, and towards the end, his wife started crying and screaming, "I want to go too! I want to go too!"And with his last measure of strength, McKinley turned to her and spoke his last words: "We are all going.

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: A small but noteworthy note. I've seen so many young men over the years who think they're running at other young men. They are not. They are running at me.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
Quote: Does it hurt?"The childish question had escaped Harry's lips before he could stop it. "Dying? Not at all,"said Sirius. "Quicker and easier than falling asleep.

Author: Mitch Albom
Quote: Love is how you stay alive, even after you are gone.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Want
Quote: I want to write my own eulogy, and I want to write it in Latin. It seems only fitting to read a dead language at my funeral.

Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables
Quote: It is nothing to die. It is frightful not to live.

Author: George R.R. Martin,  A Game of Thrones
Quote: Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: Sleep, those little slices of death — how I loathe them.

Author: Stephenie Meyer,  Twilight
Quote: Death is Peaceful, Life is Harder

Author: أحمد خالد توفيق
Quote: لا أخاف الموت ..أخاف أن أموت قبل أن أحيا

Author: Charles Bukowski
Quote: there is a place in the heart thatwill never be filleda spaceand even during thebest momentsandthe greatest timestimeswe will know itwe will know itmore thaneverthere is a place in the heart thatwill never be filledandwe will waitandwaitin that space.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Sourcery
Quote: And what would humans be without love?"RARE, said Death.

Author: Jodi Picoult
Quote: and he suddenly knew that if she killed herself, he would die. Maybe not immediately, maybe not with the same blinding rush of pain, but it would happen. You couldn't live for very long without a heart.

Author: Kenzaburō Ōe,  Hiroshima Notes
Quote: The dead can survive as part of the lives of those that still live.

Author: Connie Willis,  Passage
Quote: That's what literature is. It's the people who went before us, tapping out messages from the past, from beyond the grave, trying to tell us about life and death! Listen to them!

Author: Haruki Murakami,  Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman: 24 Stories
Quote: Death is not the opposite of life, but a part of it.

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: His soul sat up. It met me. Those kinds of souls always do - the best ones. The ones who rise up and say "I know who you are and I am ready. Not that I want to go, of course, but I will come."Those souls are always light because more of them have been put out. More of them have already found their way to other places.

Author: J.D. Salinger,  The Catcher in the Rye
Quote: When you're dead, they really fix you up. I hope to hell when I do die somebody has sense enough to just dump me in the river or something. Anything except sticking me in a goddam cemetery. People coming and putting a bunch of flowers on your stomach on Sunday, and all that crap. Who wants flowers when you're dead? Nobody.

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: Death is no more than passing from one room into another. But there's a difference for me, you know. Because in that other room I shall be able to see.

Author: Anaïs Nin
Quote: People living deeply have no fear of death.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: No one really knows why they are alive until they know what they'd die for.

Author: Antonio Porchia
Quote: One lives in the hope of becoming a memory.

Author: Isaac Asimov
Quote: Life is pleasant. Death is peaceful. It's the transition that's troublesome.

Author: Ernest Hemingway
Quote: Every man's life ends the same way. It is only the details of how he lived and how he died that distinguish one man from another.

Author: Steve Jobs
Quote: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. Don't be trapped by dogma - which is living with the results of other people's thinking. Don't let the noise of other's opinions drown out your own inner voice. And most important, have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow already know what you truly want to become. Everything else is secondary.

Author: Will Rogers
Quote: If there are no dogs in Heaven, then when I die I want to go where they went.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Quote: Your mother died to save you. If there is one thing Voldemort cannot understand, it is love. Love as powerful as your mother's for you leaves it's own mark. To have been loved so deeply, even though the person who loved us is gone, will give us some protection forever.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
Quote: Here lies Dobby, a free elf.

Author: Arthur Golden,  Memoirs of a Geisha
Quote: At the temple there is a poem called "Loss"carved into the stone. It has three words, but the poet has scratched them out. You cannot read loss, only feel it.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  Ariel
Quote: Dying is an art.Like everything else,I do it exceptionally well.I do it so it feels like hell.I do it so it feels real.I guess you could say I have a call.

Author: Neil Young
Quote: It's better to burn out than to fade away.

Author: Thomas Campbell
Quote: To live in hearts we leave behind is not to die.

Author: Benjamin Franklin
Quote: Many people die at twenty five and aren't buried until they are seventy five.

Author: Benjamin Franklin
Quote: Fear not death for the sooner we die, the longer we shall be immortal.

Author: Lao Tzu,  Tao Te Ching
Quote: A man with outward courage dares to die; a man with inner courage dares to live.

Author: Jeaniene Frost
Quote: If I die, I will wait for you, do you understand? No matter how long. I will watch from beyond to make sure you live every year you have to its fullest, and then we’ll have so much to talk about when I see you again… (Bones)

Author: Rachel Caine,  Feast of Fools
Quote: I'm gonna kill him,"Eve said, or at least that was what it sounded like filtered through the pillow.Stake him right in the heart, shove garlic up his ass, and-and-"And what?"(Michael)When did you get home?"Claire demanded.Apparently just in time to hear my funeral plans. I especially like the garlic up the ass. It's...different.

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: Together, they would watch everything that was so carefully planned collapse, and they would smile at the beauty of destruction.

Author: Franz Kafka
Quote: The meaning of life is that it stops.

Author: Nalo Hopkinson,  Brown Girl in the Ring
Quote: The heaviness of loss in her heart hadn't eased, but there was room there for humour, too.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Mort
Quote: He'd been wrong, there was a light at the end of the tunnel, and it was a flamethrower.

Author: Suzanne Collins,  Catching Fire
Quote: The idea of being strong for someone else having never entered their heads, I find myself in the position of having to console them. Since I'm the person going in to be slaughtered, this is somewhat annoying.

Author: Arthur Golden,  Memoirs of a Geisha
Quote: The heart dies a slow death, shedding each hope like leaves until one day there are none. No hopes. Nothing remains.

Author: James Patterson,  The Angel Experiment
Quote: The funny thing about facing imminent death is that it really snaps everything else into perspective.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
Quote: Would it hurt to die?

Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars
Quote: You do not immortalize the lost by writing about them. Language buries, but does not resurrect.

Author: Terry Pratchett
Quote: Death: "THERE ARE BETTER THINGS IN THE WORLD THAN ALCOHOL, ALBERT."Albert: "Oh, yes, sir. But alcohol sort of compensates for not getting them.

Author: Dylan Thomas
Quote: Though lovers be lost, love shall not; And death shall have no dominion.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Survivor
Quote: Reality means you live until you die...the real truth is nobody wants reality.

Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Princess
Quote: No one can say that death found in me a willing comrade, or that I went easily.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: For what is it to die but to stand naked in the wind and to melt into the sun? And when the earth shall claim your limbs, then shall you truly dance.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
Quote: I wish...I wish I were dead...”“And what use would that be to anyone?

Author: William S. Burroughs
Quote: Nobody owns life, but anyone who can pick up a frying pan owns death.

Author: Dean Koontz,  The Darkest Evening of the Year
Quote: Because God is never cruel, there is a reason for all things. We must know the pain of loss; because if we never knew it, we would have no compassion for others, and we would become monsters of self-regard, creatures of unalloyed self-interest. The terrible pain of loss teaches humility to our prideful kind, has the power to soften uncaring hearts, to make a better person of a good one.

Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars
Quote: Because there is no glory in illness. There is no meaning to it. There is no honor in dying of.

Author: Sarah Ockler,  Twenty Boy Summer
Quote: Weeping is not the same thing as crying. It takes your whole body to weep, and when it's over, you feel like you don't have any bones left to hold you up.

Author: Arthur Schopenhauer,  Parerga and Paralipomena
Quote: Mostly it is loss which teaches us about the worth of things.

Author: Lemony Snicket,  The Bad Beginning
Quote: It is useless for me to describe to you how terrible Violet, Klaus, and even Sunny felt in the time that followed. If you have ever lost someone very important to you, then you already know how it feels, and if you haven't, you cannot possibly imagine it.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Quote: Killing is not so easy as the innocent believe.

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Everything Is Illuminated
Quote: It's true, I am afraid of dying. I am afraid of the world moving forward without me, of my absence going unnoticed, or worse, being some natural force propelling life on. Is it selfish? Am I such a bad person for dreaming of a world that ends when I do? I don't mean the world ending with respect to me, but every set of eyes closing with mine.

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: I want words at my funeral. But I guess that means you need life in your life.

Author: Alice Sebold,  The Lovely Bones
Quote: Nothing is ever certain.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: The death of a beautiful woman is, unquestionably, the most poetical topic in the world.

Author: Gloria Steinem
Quote: Men should think twice before making widowhood women's only path to power.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  Norwegian Wood
Quote: No truth can cure the sorrow we feel from losing a loved one. No truth, no sincerity, no strength, no kindness can cure that sorrow. All we can do is see it through to the end and learn something from it, but what we learn will be no help in facing the next sorrow that comes to us without warning.

Author: Jim Morrison
Quote: No one here gets out alive.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.

Author: Michael Crichton
Quote: It's better to die laughing than to live each moment in fear.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Night Watch
Quote: We who think we are about to die will laugh at anything.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Mark of Athena
Quote: Delaying death is one of my favorite hobbies

Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska
Quote: I felt the unfairness of it, the inarguable injustice of loving someone who might have loved you back but can't due to deadness.

Author: Garth Stein,  The Art of Racing in the Rain
Quote: He died that day because his body had served its purpose. His soul had done what it came to do, learned what it came to learn, and then was free to leave.

Author: Rob Sheffield,  Love Is a Mix Tape
Quote: When we die, we will turn into songs, and we will hear each other and remember each other.

Author: Charles Bukowski
Quote: I carry death in my left pocket. Sometimes I take it out and talk to it: "Hello, baby, how you doing? When you coming for me? I'll be ready.

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: I wanted to explain that I am constantly overestimating and underestimating the human race - that rarely do I even simply estimate it. I wanted to ask her how the same thing could be so ugly and so glorious, and its words and stories so damning and brilliant...I AM HAUNTED BY HUMANS.

Author: Gayle Forman,  If I Stay
Quote: Adam is crying and somewhere inside of me I am crying, too, because I'm feeling things at last. I'm feeling not just the physical pain, but all that I have lost, and it is profound and catastrophic and will leave a crater in me that nothing will ever fill.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Survivor
Quote: Six hundred and forty fish later, the only thing I know is everything you love will die. The first time you meet someone special, you can count on them one day being dead and in the ground.

Author: Brian Andreas,  Story People: Selected Stories & Drawings of Brian Andreas
Quote: I was waiting for the longest time, she said. I thought you forgot.It is hard to forget, I said, when there is such an empty space when you are gone.

Author: John Steinbeck,  East of Eden
Quote: It seems to me that if you or I must choose between two courses of thought or action, we should remember our dying and try so to live that our death brings no pleasure to the world.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Want Two apply for a job at our country's largest funeral home, and then wear a suit and noose to the job interview.
Quote: I want to scream sometimes, because I hate when people refer to a dead person as the “late” so and so. I’m sorry to break that bad news, but that person isn’t just late—they’re not even coming!

Author: Neil Gaiman,  Anansi Boys
Quote: Everybody going to be dead one day, just give them time.

Author: Jeffrey Eugenides,  The Virgin Suicides
Quote: In the end, it wasn't death that surprised her but the stubbornness of life.

Author: China Miéville,  The Scar
Quote: In time, in time they tell me, I'll not feel so bad. I don't want time to heal me. There's a reason I'm like this.I want time to set me ugly and knotted with loss of you, marking me. I won't smooth you away.I can't say goodbye.

Author: Nick Hornby,  A Long Way Down
Quote: A man who wants to die feels angry and full of life and desperate and bored and exhausted, all at the same time; he wants to fight everyone, and he wants to curl up in a ball and hide in a cupboard somewhere. He wants to say sorry to everyone, and he wants everyone to know just how badly they've all let him down.

Author: Cornelia Funke,  Inkdeath
Quote: Women were different, no doubt about it. Men broke so much more quickly. Grief didn't break women. Instead it wore them down, it hollowed them out very slowly.

Author: Karen Marie Moning,  Shadowfever
Quote: Dying is overrated. Human sentimentality has twisted it into the ultimate act of love. Biggest load of bullshit in the world. Dying for someone isn't the hard thing. The man that dies escapes. Plain and simple. Game over. End of pain...Try living for someone. Through it all-good, bad, thick, thin, joy, suffering. That's the hard thing.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Going Postal
Quote: Do you not know that a man is not dead while his name is still spoken?

Author: John Lennon
Quote: I'm not afraid of death because I don't believe in it.It's just getting out of one car, and into another.

Author: Albert Camus,  Neither Victims Nor Executioners
Quote: It is the job of thinking people not to be on the side of the executioners.

Author: Lili St. Crow,  Jealousy
Quote: I was always holding onto people, and they were always leaving.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Mercy
Quote: How could you go about choosing something that would hold the half of your heart you had to bury?

Author: Stephenie Meyer,  Twilight
Quote: Surely it was a good way to die, in the place of someone else, someone I loved.

Author: E.B. White,  Charlotte's Web
Quote: After all, what's a life, anyway? We're born, we live a little while, we die.

Author: W.H. Auden,  Collected Poems
Quote: He was my North, my South, my East and West,My working week and my Sunday rest,My noon, my midnight, my talk, my song;I thought that love would last forever: I was wrong.

Author: John Donne,  No man is an island – A selection from the prose
Quote: No man is an island, entire of itself; every man is a piece of the continent, a part of the main. If a clod be washed away by the sea, Europe is the less, as well as if a promontory were, as well as if a manor of thy friend's or of thine own were: any man's death diminishes me, because I am involved in mankind, and therefore never send to know for whom the bells tolls; it tolls for thee.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Who Moved My Choose?: An Amazing Way to Deal With Change by Deciding to Let Indecision Into Your Life
Quote: I’m willing to die for the woman I love. I just want to take 75 years to do it.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Titan's Curse
Quote: Stars,"she whispered. "I can see the stars again, my lady."A tear trickled down Artemis's cheek. "Yes, my brave one. They are beautiful tonight."Stars,"Zoe repeated. Her eyes fixed on the night sky. And she did not move again.

Author: Steve Jobs
Quote: If you live each day as it was your last, someday you'll most certainly be right

Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet
Quote: O serpent heart hid with a flowering face!Did ever a dragon keep so fair a cave?Beautiful tyrant, feind angelical, dove feather raven, wolvish-ravening lamb! Despised substance of devinest show, just opposite to what thou justly seemest - A dammed saint, an honourable villain!

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: A SMALL PIECE OF TRUTHI do not carry a sickle or scythe.I only wear a hooded black robe when it's cold.And I don't have those skull-like facial features you seem to enjoy pinning on me from a distance. You want to know what I truly look like? I'll help you out. Find yourself a mirror while I continue.

Author: H.P. Lovecraft,  The Nameless City
Quote: That is not dead which can eternal lie,And with strange aeons even death may die.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. And the ageless sages.
Quote: Love is a circular emotion that surrounds you, like a hug. Or a noose.

Author: Ernest Hemingway
Quote: Madame, all stories, if continued far enough, end in death, and he is no true-story teller who would keep that from you.

Author: Richelle Mead,  Frostbite
Quote: Things die. But they don't always stay dead. Believe me, I know.

Author: Meghan O'Rourke
Quote: Relationships take up energy; letting go of them, psychiatrists theorize, entails mental work. When you lose someone you were close to, you have to reassess your picture of the world and your place in it. The more your identity was wrapped up with the deceased, the more difficult the loss.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  There are Two Typos of People in This World: Those Who Can Edit and Those Who Can't
Quote: I’ve always felt that the best place to hide a body is in the trunk of a cop car, with a note affixed to the body that reads, “I’m sorry.

Author: Joseph Stalin
Quote: A single death is a tragedy; a million deaths is a statistic.

Author: Norman Cousins
Quote: Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside us while we live.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Bell Jar
Quote: I told him I believed in hell, and that certain people, like me, had to live in hell before they died, to make up for missing out on it after death, since they didn't believe in life after death, and what each person believed happened to him when he died.

Author: Langston Hughes
Quote: I went down to the river,I set down on the bank.I tried to think but couldn't,So I jumped in and sank.

Author: Hunter S. Thompson
Quote: No More Games. No More Bombs. No More Walking. No More Fun. No More Swimming. 67. That is 17 years past 50. 17 more than I needed or wanted. Boring. I am always bitchy. No Fun — for anybody. 67. You are getting Greedy. Act your old age. Relax — This won't hurt

Author: Jarod Kintz,  The Titanic would never have sunk if it were made out of a sink.
Quote: He had a new girl, and I told him she looked like Marilyn Monroe. He smiled because he thought I meant she was beautiful, and I smiled because I meant she looked like a corpse.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
Quote: Would you like me to [kill you] now?"asked Snape, his voice heavy with irony. "Or would you like a few moments to compose an epitaph?

Author: Chuck Palahniuk
Quote: It's easy to cry when you realize that everyone you love will reject you or die.

Author: Janet Fitch,  White Oleander
Quote: The phoenix must burn to emerge.

Author: Neil Gaiman,  Good Omens: The Nice and Accurate Prophecies of Agnes Nutter, Witch
Quote: You're Hell's Angels, then? What chapter are you from?''REVELATIONS. CHAPTER SIX.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Hamlet
Quote: Sweets to the sweet.

Author: Mitch Albom,  For One More Day
Quote: But she wasn’t around, and that’s the thing when your parents die, you feel like instead of going in to every fight with backup, you are going into every fight alone.

Author: Sarah J. Maas,  Crown of Midnight
Quote: But death was her curse and her gift, and death had been her good friend these long, long years.

Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars
Quote: I will not tell you our love story, because-like all real love stories-it will die with us,as it should.

Author: Arthur Schopenhauer
Quote: They tell us that Suicide is the greatest piece of Cowardice... That Suicide is wrong; when it is quite obvious that there is nothing in this world to which every man has a more unassailable title than to his own life and person.

Author: Christopher Hitchens,  Hitch-22: A Memoir
Quote: What do you most value in your friends?Their continued existence.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Survivor
Quote: It's only in drugs or death we'll see anything new, and death is just too controlling.

Author: Sean Mangan
Quote: Life is too short when you think of the length of death

Author: Albert Camus,  The Myth of Sisyphus and Other Essays
Quote: What is called a reason for living is also an excellent reason for dying.

Author: Margaret Mitchell,  Gone with the Wind
Quote: Death, taxes and childbirth! There's never any convenient time for any of them.

Author: Roland Barthes
Quote: Each of us has his own rhythm of suffering.

Author: Jeanette Winterson,  Gut Symmetries
Quote: He: What’s the matter with you?Me: Nothing.Nothing was slowly clotting my arteries. Nothing slowly numbing my soul. Caught by nothing, saying nothing, nothingness becomes me. When I am nothing they will say surprised in the way that they are forever surprised, "but there was nothing the matter with her.

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close
Quote: I thought about all of the things that everyone ever says to each other, and how everyone is going to die, whether it's in a millisecond, or days, or months, or 76.5 years, if you were just born. Everything that's born has to die, which means our lives are like skyscrapers. The smoke rises at different speeds, but they're all on fire, and we're all trapped.

Author: Jo Nesbø
Quote: Losing your life is not the worst thing that can happen. The worst thing is to lose your reason for living.

Author: Edvard Munch
Quote: From my rotting body, flowers shall grow and I am in them, and that is eternity.

Author: Eckhart Tolle
Quote: Death is a stripping away of all that is not you. The secret of life is to "die before you die"--- and find that there is no death.

Author: Rick Yancey,  The 5th Wave
Quote: We'd stared into the face of Death, and Death blinked first. You'd think that would make us feel brave and invincible. It didn't.

Author: Alexander Pushkin
Quote: I have outlasted all desire,My dreams and I have grown apart;My grief alone is left entire,The gleamings of an empty heart.The storms of ruthless dispensationHave struck my flowery garland numb,I live in lonely desolationAnd wonder when my end will come.Thus on a naked tree-limb, blastedBy tardy winter's whistling chill,A single leaf which has outlastedIts season will be trembling still.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I’ll be your Dostoevsky, if you’ll be my Tolstoy. Our life together will be so full of despair that death will be like a gulag full of joy.

Author: Raymond Carver,  Where I'm Calling From: New and Selected Stories
Quote: I've crossed some kind of invisible line. I feel as if I've come to a place I never thought I'd have to come to. And I don't know how I got here. It's a strange place. It's a place where a little harmless dreaming and then some sleepy, early-morning talk has led me into considerations of death and annihilation.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: Carve your name on hearts, not tombstones. A legacy is etched into the minds of others and the stories they share about you.

Author: Richard Puz,  The Carolinian
Quote: Death leaves a heartache no one can heal, love leaves a memory no one can steal.From an Irish headstone

Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne,  The Blithedale Romance
Quote: Death should take me while I am in the mood.

Author: George Eliot,  Adam Bede
Quote: What greater thing is there for two human souls, than to feel that they are joined for life--to strengthen each other in all labor, to rest on each other in all sorrow, to minister to each other in all pain, to be one with each other in silent unspeakable memories at the moment of the last parting?

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: If they killed him tonight, at least he would die alive.

Author: Maria V. Snyder,  Storm Glass
Quote: Everyone grieves in different ways. For some, it could take longer or shorter. I do know it never disappears. An ember still smolders inside me. Most days, I don’t notice it, but, out of the blue, it’ll flare to life.

Author: Hans Christian Andersen
Quote: Enjoy life. There's plenty of time to be dead.

Author: Robyn Schneider,  The Beginning of Everything
Quote: Life is the tragedy,' she said bitterly. 'You know how they categorize Shakespeare's plays, right? If it ends with a wedding, it's a comedy. And if it ends with a funeral, it's a tragedy. So we're all living tragedies, because we all end the same way, and it isn't with a goddamn wedding.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Richard III
Quote: So wise so young, they say, do never live long.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe,  The Premature Burial
Quote: The boundaries which divide Life from Death are at best shadowy and vague. Who shall say where the one ends, and where the other begins?

Author: Haruki Murakami,  Norwegian Wood
Quote: People leave strange little memories of themselves behind when they die.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook
Quote: Our lives can't be measured by our final years, of this I am sure.

Author: Gayle Forman,  If I Stay
Quote: Sleep would be so welcome. A warm blanket of black to erase everything else. Sleep without dreams. I've heard people talk about the sleep of the dead. Is that what death would feel like? The nicest, warmest, heaviest never-ending nap? If that's what it's like, I wouldn't mind. If that's what dying is like, I wouldn't mind that at all.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Quote: End? No, the journey doesn't end here. Death is just another path, one that we all must take. The grey rain-curtain of this world rolls back, and all turns to silver glass, and then you see it.

Author: Madeline Miller,  The Song of Achilles
Quote: When he died, all things soft and beautiful and bright would be buried with him.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Some people try to change the world one life at a time. Others try to change the world one death at a time. And I try to change the world one bucket full of dirt at a time.

Author: Jostein Gaarder,  Sophie's World
Quote: Life is both sad and solemn. We are led into a wonderful world, we meet one another here, greet each other - and wander together for a brief moment. Then we lose each other and disappear as suddenly and unreasonably as we arrived.

Author: Clifford Odets
Quote: If they tell you that she died of sleeping pills you must know that she died of a wasting grief, of a slow bleeding at the soul.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: Me: On time. Love: Late. Death: Early. Seriously, why are you late?

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: Your love story, I don’t want to give away the ending, but both you and your lover die.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Reaper Man
Quote: No one is actually dead until the ripples they cause in the world die away...

Author: Roger Zelazny,  Frost & Fire
Quote: I know, too, that death is the only god who comes when you call.

Author: Epicurus
Quote: Death, therefore, the most awful of evils, is nothing to us, seeing that, when we are, death is not come, and, when death is come, we are not.

Author: Bill Hicks
Quote: The whole image is that eternal suffering awaits anyone who questions God's infinite love. That's the message we're brought up with, isn't it? Believe or die! Thank you, forgiving Lord, for all those options.

Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska
Quote: There comes a time when we realize that our parents cannot save themselves or save us, that everyone who wades through time eventually gets dragged out to sea by the undertow- that, in short, we are all going.

Author: George Gordon Byron
Quote: Death, so called, is a thing which makes men weep, And yet a third of life is passed in sleep.

Author: Elizabeth Berg,  The Year of Pleasures
Quote: There is love in holding and there is love in letting go.

Author: Richard Adams,  Watership Down
Quote: My heart has joined the Thousand, for my friend stopped running today.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: A stick won’t stick to a wall, so why is it called a stick? Likewise, why aren’t love and ghost the same word? Both are dead and invisible.

Author: Horace,  The Odes of Horace: Bilingual Edition
Quote: Pulvis et umbra sumus. (We are but dust and shadow.)

Author: Gayle Forman,  Just One Day
Quote: We are born in one day. We die in one day. We can change in one day. And we can fall in love in one day. Anything can happen in just one day.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Bell Jar
Quote: The trouble about jumping was that if you didn't pick the right number of storeys, you might still be alive when you hit bottom.

Author: Franz Kafka
Quote: He is terribly afraid of dying because he hasn’t yet lived.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Love burns. Whiskey burns. George Burns. What do all three have in common? They’re all dead to me.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  My love can only occupy one person at a time
Quote: My ashtray is full, the carton of cigarettes is empty, and I just cremated grandpa. But I never inhaled—or told him I loved him.

Author: Mark Haddon,  The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time
Quote: I think people believe in heaven because they don't like the idea of dying, because they want to carry on living and they don't like the idea that other people will move into their house and put their things into the rubbish.

Author: John Grogan,  Marley and Me: Life and Love With the World's Worst Dog
Quote: . . . owning a dog always ended with this sadness because dogs just don't live as long as people do.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Bell Jar
Quote: Death must be so beautiful. To lie in the soft brown earth, with the grasses waving above one’s head, and listen to silence. To have no yesterday, and no tomorrow. To forget time, to forgive life, to be at peace.

Author: Courtney Love,  Dirty Blonde: The Diaries of Courtney Love
Quote: The language of love letters is the same as suicide notes.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I think eulogies are wasted on the dead. It’s the living who need to hear kind words spoken about them.

Author: David Eagleman,  Sum: Forty Tales from the Afterlives
Quote: There are three deaths. The first is when the body ceases to function. The second is when the body is consigned to the grave. The third is that moment, sometime in the future, when your name is spoken for the last time.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: Even in the grave, all is not lost.

Author: Cecelia Ahern,  P.S. I Love You
Quote: She had been given a wonderful gift: life. Sometimes it was cruelly taken away too soon, but it's what you did with it that counted, not how long it lasted.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I make love like I make coffins—with my bare hands, alone in my garage. On sale through Thursday—Buy One Funeral, Get A Second One Free!

Author: Jorge Luis Borges
Quote: When writers die they become books, which is, after all, not too bad an incarnation."[As attributed by Alastair Reid in Neruda and Borges, The New Yorker, June 24, 1996; as well as in The Talk of the Town, The New Yorker, July 7, 1986]

Author: Kristin Cashore,  Fire
Quote: It was a hurting tune, resigned, a cry of heartache for all in the world that fell apart. As ash rose black against the brilliant sky, Fire's fiddle cried out for the dead, and for the living who stay behind to say goodbye.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: You can never be too early to stand around and wait. You can have a seat in this chair, after I cinch the noose around my neck and you kick it out from under my legs.

Author: Milan Kundera,  Laughable Loves
Quote: Yes, it's a well-known fact about you: you're like death, you take everything.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: For the funeral I needed a plus one, so I rented a hooker. And then I rented a movie. Rest in peace Grandpa, or whoever you were.

Author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
Quote: Tell your friend that in his death, a part of you dies and goes with him. Wherever he goes, you also go. He will not be alone.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I buried the lasagna, because it was better than disposing of a dead body. I’ve been burned in a relationship, but never in an oven. I’ll try harder.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I can’t use my intellect to figure out how to bypass my intellect. Love lies through the spirit, not the mind, and love never lies.

Author: Jeanette Winterson,  Written on the Body
Quote: Time that withers you will wither me. We will fall like ripe fruit and roll down the grass together. Dear friend, let me lie beside you watching the clouds until the earth covers us and we are gone.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: Asking me if I’m in love is like asking a mortician if now is the best time to die.

Author: Marcel Proust
Quote: People do not die for us immediately, but remain bathed in a sort of aura oflife which bears no relation to true immortality but through which theycontinue to occupy our thoughts in the same way as when they were alive. Itis as though they were traveling abroad.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: If you’re going to hang around and watch me write, you might as well have a noose around your neck. Would you mind if I kicked the chair out from under your feet? You’re standing on my only place to sit.

Author: Jandy Nelson,  I'll Give You the Sun
Quote: People die, I think, but your relationship with them doesn't. It continues and is ever-changing.

Author: K-Ske Hasegawa,  Ballad of a Shinigami, Vol. 1
Quote: Crap.It's all crap.Living is crap.Life has no meaning.None. Nowhere to be found.Crap.Why doesn't anybody realize this?

Author: Jennifer Donnelly,  Revolution
Quote: I'm wishing he could see that music lives. Forever. That it's stronger than death. Stronger than time. And that its strength holds you together when nothing else can.

Author: Melina Marchetta,  Saving Francesca
Quote: A piece of me is gone,"she told me once while we were bra shopping. "I think we're made up of all these different pieces and every time someone goes, you're left with less of yourself.

Author: Daniel Keyes,  Flowers for Algernon
Quote: I am afraid. Not of life, or death, or nothingness, but of wasting it as if I had never been.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Some people grow vegetables by day, but I grow shadows by night. Right now my only customer is the US government, but the profit is unbelievable.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I just developed a gun that shoots mustaches. Sometimes a disguise can be deadly, especially if it’s your love you’re trying to camouflage.

Author: Jim Butcher,  Dead Beat
Quote: Son. Everyone dies alone. That's what it is. It's a door. It's one person wide. When you go through it, you do it alone. But it doesn't mean you've got to be alone before you go through the door. And believe me, you aren't alone on the other side.

Author: Dark Jar Tin Zoo,  Love Quotes for the Ages. Specifically Ages 19-91.
Quote: Our love was a two-person game. At least until one of us died, and the other became a murderer.

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: It was a year for the ages, like 79, like 1346, to name just a few. Forget the scythe, Goddamn it, I needed a broom or a mop. And I needed a vacation.

Author: Michel Houellebecq
Quote: The absence of the will to live is, alas, not sufficient to make one want to die.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  It Occurred to Me
Quote: If flowers were boogers, I'd pick a few big ones and flick them on your grave.

Author: Charles Dickens,  A Tale of Two Cities
Quote: Before I go,"he said, and paused -- "I may kiss her?"It was remembered afterwards that when he bent down and touched her face with his lips, he murmured some words. The child, who was nearest to him, told them afterwards, and told her grandchildren when she was a handsome old lady, that she heard him say, "A life you love.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  American Association for the Advancement of Aardvarks Presents: Dear Natalie
Quote: Yesterday I saved a baby, a boy, a man, and an old man from death, and all by simply not impregnating anybody. But I don't consider myself a hero. Merely heroic, and also unable to reach any of my lady friends on the phone.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet
Quote: O, hereWill I set up my everlasting rest,And shake the yoke of inauspicious starsFrom this world-wearied flesh. Eyes, look your last!Arms, take your last embrace! and, lips, O youThe doors of breath, seal with a righteous kissA dateless bargain to engrossing death!

Author: Socrates
Quote: The hour of departure has arrived, and we go our separate ways, I to die, and you to live. Which of these two is better only God knows.

Author: Robert Galbraith,  The Cuckoo's Calling
Quote: How could the death of someone you had never met affect you so?

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: The reports of my death are greatly exaggerated.

Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Angel
Quote: Pulvis et umbra sumus. It's a line from Horace. 'We are dust and shadows'. Appropriate, don't you think?"Will said. "It's not a long life, killing demons; one tends to die young, and then they burn your body - dust to dust, in the literal sense. And then we vanish into the shadows of history, nary a mark on the page of a mundane book to remind the world that once we existed at all.

Author: R.J. Palacio,  Wonder
Quote: Do people look the same when they go to heaven, mommy?""I don't know. I don't think so.""Then how do people recognize each other?""I don't know, sweetie. They just feel it. You don't need your eyes to love, right?

Author: Frank Herbert,  Dune
Quote: There is no escape—we pay for the violence of our ancestors.

Author: Thomas Mann,  The Magic Mountain
Quote: It is love, not reason, that is stronger than death.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: When I die, remember to remove my body from the cooler before you start making the hunch punch. But by all means, do get drunk on my memory.

Author: H.L. Mencken
Quote: If, after I depart this vale, you ever remember me and have thought to please my ghost, forgive some sinner and wink your eye at some homely girl.

Author: Frederick Weatherly
Quote: But when ye come, and all the flowers are dying,If I am dead, as dead I well may be,You'll come and find the place where I am lying,And kneel and say Ave there for me,And I shall hear, though soft you tread above me,And all my grave will warmer, sweeter be,For you will bend and tell me that you love me,And I shall sleep in peace until you come to me

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I drink coffee like steam is the ghost of dead water. Ever tried inhaling the afterlife?

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I’m so sunburned I’m embarrassed, but you can’t tell I’m blushing because I’m sunburned. I’m so ashamed I could just lie on the beach and die.

Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
Quote: I would request that my body in death be buried not cremated, so that the energy content contained within it gets returned to the earth, so that flora and fauna can dine upon it, just as I have dined upon flora and fauna during my lifetime

Author: C.S. Lewis,  A Grief Observed
Quote: The death of a beloved is an amputation.

Author: Sylvia Plath
Quote: The thought that I might kill myself formed in my mind coolly as a tree or a flower.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  My Sister's Keeper
Quote: See, as much as you want to hold on to the bitter sore memory that someone has left this world, you are still in it. And the very act of living is a tide: at first it seems to make no difference at all, and then one day you look down and see how much pain has eroded.

Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska
Quote: You can't just make yourself matter and then die, Alaska, because now I am irretrievably different, and I'm sorry I let you go, yes, but you made the choice. You left me Perhapsless, stuck in your goddamned labyrinth. And now I don't even know if you chose the straight and fast way out, if you left me like this on purpose. And so I never knew you, did I? I can't remember, because I never knew.

Author: Ray Bradbury,  Something Wicked This Way Comes
Quote: Death doesn't exist. It never did, it never will. But we've drawn so many pictures of it, so many years, trying to pin it down, comprehend it, we've got to thinking of it as an entity, strangely alive and greedy. All it is, however, is a stopped watch, a loss, an end, a darkness. Nothing.

Author: Mitch Albom,  For One More Day
Quote: I hope you never hear those words. Your mom. She died. They are different than other words. They are too big to fit in your ears. They belong to some strange, heavy, powerful language that pounds away at the side of your head, a wrecking ball coming at you again and again, until finally, the words crack a hole large enough to fit inside your brain. And in so doing, they split you apart.

Author: Alyson Noel,  Blue Moon
Quote: You can’t go back, Ever. You can’t change the past. It just is. . . . This is our destiny. Not yours.

Author: Milan Kundera,  The Unbearable Lightness of Being
Quote: Dogs do not have many advantages over people, but one of them is extremely important: euthanasia is not forbidden by law in their case; animals have the right to a merciful death.

Author: Ellen DeGeneres
Quote: Stuffed deer heads on walls are bad enough, but it’s worse when you see them wearing dark glasses, having streamers around their necks and a hat on their antlers. Because then you know they were enjoying themselves at a party when they were shot.

Author: Stephen Hawking
Quote: I have noticed that even those who assert that everything is predestined and that we can change nothing about it still look both ways before they cross the street

Author: Lauren Oliver,  Before I Fall
Quote: In my dream I know I am falling. But there is no up or down, no walls or sides or ceilings, just the sensation of cold and darkness everywhere. I am so scared I could scream. But when I open my mouth, nothing happens. And I wonder if you fall forever and never touch down, is it really still falling? I think I will fall forever.

Author: Samuel Beckett,  Endgame
Quote: The end is in the beginning and yet you go on.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Dreaming is for lovers
Quote: I had a dream about you. Flowers were overflowing in the cemetery, so we decided to have a picnic there. You brought apple pie, and I brought my Aunt Mildred, who’d been dead for some time and I just hadn’t gotten around to disposing of her body. I thought you’d think me both efficient and romantic, but it turns out you didn’t. You only saw the romantic side of my action.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: You are not your body. You are the sum of all your actions, and they live on after your body dies. You may be mortal, but your brand is eternal.

Author: Heather Brewer,  Ninth Grade Slays
Quote: It never gets easier, missing you. And sometimes I wonder if it ever will.

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: for some reason, dying men always ask the question they know the answer to. perhaps it's so they can die being right.

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: ***HERE IS A SMALL FACT*** You are going to die.

Author: Lauren Oliver,  Requiem
Quote: Live free or die.

Author: D. Aswini,  Saffron - The Blood Swan
Quote: Death is unstoppable. One must face it as a fact of life

Author: G.K. Chesterton
Quote: The man who kills a man kills a man.The man who kills himself kills all men.As far as he is concerned, he wipes out the world.

Author: Gavin de Becker,  The Gift of Fear: Survival Signals That Protect Us from Violence
Quote: Most men fear getting laughed at or humiliated by a romantic prospect while most women fear rape and death.

Author: Veronica Roth,  Allegiant
Quote: I keep finding myself stifled by the company of others and then crippled by loneliness when I leave them. I am terrified and I don't even know of what, because I have lost everything already.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Reaper Man
Quote: YOU FEAR TO DIE?"It's not that I don't want... I mean, I've always...it's just that life is a habit that's hard to break...

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book Has No Title
Quote: The police seemed to think I killed her, which is crazy, because I loved her like a thousand drops of blood dripping down a dagger.

Author: Don DeLillo,  White Noise
Quote: No sense of the irony of human experience, that we are the highest form of life on earth, and yet ineffably sad because we know what no other animal knows, that we must die.

Author: Roman Payne,  Hope and Despair
Quote: It’s not that we have to quit this life one day, it’s how many things we have to quit all at once: holding hands, hotel rooms, music, the physics of falling leaves, vanilla and jasmine, poppies, smiling, anthills, the color of the sky, coffee and cashmere, literature, sparks and subway trains... If only one could leave this life slowly!

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Together kabobs make the world better than all the Bobs combined. Well, at least ever since Bob Ross moved on to the land of the happy trees.

Author: John Boyne,  The Boy in the Striped Pajamas
Quote: ...Despite the mayhem that followed, Bruno found that he was still holding Shmuel's hand in his own and nothing in the world would have persuaded him to let go.

Author: Brian Andreas,  Strange Dreams: Collected Stories & Drawings
Quote: I held her close for only a short time, but after she was gone, I'd see her smile on the face of a perfect stranger and I knew she would be there with me all the rest of my days.

Author: Susan Beth Pfeffer,  Life As We Knew It
Quote: I wonder if I'll ever have to decide which is worse, life as we're living or no life at all.

Author: Jennifer Niven,  All the Bright Places
Quote: People rarely bring flowers to a suicide.

Author: Jim Morrison
Quote: We're reaching for death on the end of a candle We're trying for something that's already found us

Author: Rae Carson,  The Girl of Fire and Thorns
Quote: Honor from death,” I snap, “is a myth. Invented by the war torn to make sense of the horrific. If we die, it will be so that others may live. Truly honorable death, the only honorable death, is one that enables life.

Author: Jennifer Brown,  Hate List
Quote: Life isn't fair. A fair's a place where you eat corn dogs and ride the ferris wheel.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Julius Caesar
Quote: Of all the wonders that I have heard,It seems to me most strange that men should fear;Seeing death, a necessary end,Will come when it will come.(Act II, Scene 2)

Author: George Carlin,  Brain Droppings
Quote: So, have a little fun. Soon enough you'll be dead and burning in Hell with the rest of your family.

Author: Jim Elliot,  The Journals of Jim Elliot
Quote: When the time comes to die, make sure that all you have to do is die!

Author: Horace Mann
Quote: Be ashamed to die until you have won some victory for humanity.

Author: Christopher Paolini,  Brisingr
Quote: Death is part of who we are. It guidesus. It shapes us. It drives us to madness. Can you still be human if you have no mortal end

Author: Stephen King,  Pet Sematary
Quote: Sometimes dead is better

Author: Neil Gaiman,  The Sandman, Vol. 6: Fables and Reflections
Quote: You attend the funeral, you bid the dead farewell. You grieve. Then you continue with your life. And at times the fact of her absence will hit you like a blow to the chest, and you will weep. But this will happen less and less as time goes on. She is dead. You are alive. So live.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
Quote: Harry, you wonderful boy, you brave, brave man.

Author: Yoko Ono
Quote: Each time we don't say what we wanna say, we're dying.

Author: Oscar Wilde,  The Picture of Dorian Gray
Quote: Oh, brothers! I don't care for brothers. My elder brother won't die, and my younger brothers seem never to do anything else.

Author: Banksy,  Banging Your Head Against a Brick Wall
Quote: People who get up early in the morning cause war, death and famine.

Author: Charles Bukowski,  What Matters Most is How Well You Walk Through the Fire
Quote: Finally there is nothing here for death to take away.

Author: Stephenie Meyer,  The Host
Quote: What am I dying for?

Author: Terry Pratchett,  The Last Hero
Quote: I DON'T HOLD WITH CRUELTY TO CATS.

Author: Chelsie Shakespeare
Quote: He made me feel unhinged . . . like he could take me apart and put me back together again and again.

Author: Leo Tolstoy,  War and Peace
Quote: Man cannot possess anything as long as he fears death. But to him who does not fear it, everything belongs. If there was no suffering, man would not know his limits, would not know himself.

Author: Soman Chainani,  The School for Good and Evil
Quote: She had always found villains more exciting than heroes. They had ambition, passion. They made the stories happen. Villains didn't fear death. No, they wrapped themselves in death like suits of armor! As she inhaled the school's graveyard smell, Agatha felt her blood rush. For like all villains, death didn't scare her. It made her feel alive.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  The Color of Magic
Quote: Some pirates achieved immortality by great deeds of cruelty or derring-do. Some achieved immortality by amassing great wealth. But the captain had long ago decided that he would, on the whole, prefer to achieve immortality by not dying.

Author: David Hume,  Essays on Suicide and the Immortality of the Soul
Quote: No man ever threw away life while it was worth keeping.

Author: John Green
Quote: Hazel has to realize that her mom was wrong when she said, “I won’t be a mother anymore.” The truth is, after Hazel dies (assuming she dies), her mom will still be her mom, just as my grandmother is still my grandmother even though she has died. As long as either person is still alive, that relationship survives. (It changes, but it survives.)

Author: Laurie Faria Stolarz,  White Is for Magic
Quote: Miss Mary Mack, Mack, Mack, all dressed in black, black, black. She has a knife, knife, knife, stuck in her back, back, back. She cannot breathe, breathe, breathe. She cannot cry, cry, cry. Thats why she begs, begs, begs. She begs to die, die ,die..

Author: Tom Robbins
Quote: Those who shun the whimsy of things will experience rigor mortis before death.

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: I could introduce myself properly, but it's not really necessary. You will know me well enough and soon enough, depending on a diverse range of variables. It suffices to say that at some point in time, I will be standing over you, as genially as possible. Your soul will be in my arms. A color will be perched on my shoulder. I will carry you gently away.

Author: George S. McGovern
Quote: I'm fed up to the ears with old men dreaming up wars for young men to die in.

Author: Henry David Thoreau,  Walden
Quote: I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived.

Author: Catherynne M. Valente,  Deathless
Quote: I will not let her speak because I love her, and when you love someone, you do not make them tell war stories. A war story is a black space. On the one side is before and on the other side is after, and what is inside belongs only to the dead.

Author: Ava Dellaira,  Love Letters to the Dead
Quote: I know I wrote letters to people with no address on this earth, I know that you are dead. But I hear you. I hear all of you. We were here. Our lives matter.

Author: Aberjhani,  Visions of a Skylark Dressed in Black
Quote: You were born a child of light’s wonderful secret— you return to the beauty you have always been.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Should Have Renamed This
Quote: Time is such a waste of time to think about, because the longer you ponder it, the more of it you lose. And before you know it, you don’t know it, because you are nothing but dusty worm food.

Author: Mitch Albom,  Tuesdays with Morrie
Quote: It’s not contagious, you know. Death is as natural as life. It’s part of the deal we made.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Some men have actually died from laughing. That's so funny I fear for my own life.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: She’s ignoring my texts. Maybe she’s dead. Oh, I certainly hope so. I’d hate to think she’s being deliberately unresponsive.

Author: Hlovate,  Contengan Jalanan
Quote: Everybody know death is inevitably coming, but it never fails to catch everybody by surprise everytime one is going

Author: Charles Bukowski,  The Flash of Lightning Behind the Mountain: New Poems
Quote: Dying should come easy:like a freight train youdon't hear whenyour back isturned.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Man has two legs and chairs have four, because we were made to stand out, not sit down—or be sat on. You are your brand—you are not a piece of furniture. Well, this applies to everyone except my grandma, but she’s dead, so she really doesn’t mind being used as a coat rack.

Author: George Carlin
Quote: I was thinking about how people seem to read the bible a lot more as they get older, and then it dawned on me—they’re cramming for their final exam.

Author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  The Laughing Corpse
Quote: Death didn't bother me much. Strong Christian and all that. Method of death did. Being eaten alive. One of my top three ways not to go out.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Every day I think today could be my last day. My only fear is dying without telling her I love her one more time. All I pray for is one more time.

Author: J.D. Salinger,  The Catcher in the Rye
Quote: Anyway, I'm sort of glad they've got the atomic bomb invented. If there's ever another war, I'm going to sit right the hell on top of it. I'll volunteer for it, I swear to God I will.

Author: J.D. Salinger,  The Catcher in the Rye
Quote: who wants flowers when youre dead? nobody.

Author: Franz Kafka
Quote: Kill me, or you are a murderer.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe,  The Tell-Tale Heart and Other Writings
Quote: True, nervous, very, very dreadfully nervous I had been and am, but why will say that I am mad?! The disease had sharpened my senses, not destroyed, not dulled them. Above all was the sense of hearing acute.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  The Days of Yay are Here! Wake Me Up When They're Over.
Quote: Death cannot stop true love. That’s why it’s pointless for me to try to murder all my adoring female fans.

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: They say that war is death's best friend, but I must offer you a different point of view on that one. To me, war is like the new boss who expects the impossible. He stands over your shoulder repeating one thin, incessantly: 'Get it done, get it done.' So you work harder. You get the job done. The boss, however, does not thank you. He asks for more.

Author: Fran Lebowitz
Quote: There is no such thing as inner peace. There is only nervousness and death.

Author: Suzanne Collins,  Mockingjay
Quote: But I don't know what to him about the aftermath of killing a person. About how they never leave you.

Author: Madeleine L'Engle
Quote: Death is contagious; it is contracted the moment we are conceived.

Author: John O'Donohue,  Anam Cara: A Book of Celtic Wisdom
Quote: We do not need to grieve for the dead. Why should we grieve for them? They are now in a place where there is no more shadow, darkness, loneliness, isolation, or pain. They are home.

Author: Don DeLillo,  White Noise
Quote: I've got death inside me. It's just a question of whether or not I can outlive it.

Author: Neale Donald Walsch,  Home with God: In a Life That Never Ends
Quote: You are afraid to die, and you’re afraid to live. What a way to exist.

Author: Christopher Pike,  The Last Vampire
Quote: He cries. 'Please! I don't want to die.'I lean over. My hair smothers him.'Then you should never have been born,' I say.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Quote: Snape raised his wand and pointed it directly at Dumbledore."Avada Kedavra!

Author: Thomas Pynchon,  Gravity's Rainbow
Quote: It's been a prevalent notion. Fallen sparks. Fragments of vessels broken at the Creation. And someday, somehow, before the end, a gathering back to home. A messenger from the Kingdom, arriving at the last moment. But I tell you there is no such message, no such home -- only the millions of last moments . . . nothing more. Our history is an aggregate of last moments.

Author: Neil Gaiman,  The Sandman, Vol. 3: Dream Country
Quote: When the first living thing existed, I was there waiting. When the last living thing dies, my job will be finished. I'll put the chairs on the tables, turn out the lights and lock the universe behind me when I leave.

Author: Kevin Hearne,  Hounded
Quote: Yer a good lad, Atticus, mowin’ me lawn and killin’ what Brits come around.

Author: Emil Cioran
Quote: The fact that life has no meaning is a reason to live --moreover, the only one.

Author: Carlos Castaneda,  Journey to Ixtlan
Quote: In a world where death is the hunter, my friend, there is no time for regrets or doubts. There is only time for decisions.

Author: George Bernard Shaw,  Man and Superman
Quote: Criminals do not die by the hands of the law. They die by the hands of other men.

Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Bones
Quote: Well I'd certainly hate to interrupt your pleasant night stroll with my sudden death.

Author: Vincent van Gogh
Quote: La tristesse durera toujours.[The sadness will last forever.]

Author: Gemma Malley,  The Declaration
Quote: He said that we belonged together because he was born with a flower and I was born with a butterfly and that flowers and butterflies need each other for survival.

Author: Fernando Pessoa,  Poems of Fernando Pessoa
Quote: If after I die, people want to write my biography, there is nothing simpler. They only need two dates: the date of my birth and the date of my death. Between one and another, every day is mine.

Author: Sylvia Plath
Quote: I have stitched life into me like a rare organ

Author: J.D. Robb,  Glory in Death
Quote: We're standing here, beat to shit, walking away from a crime scene where either or both of us could have bought it, and you're asking me to marry you?""Perfect timing.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  The Waves
Quote: For this moment, this one moment, we are together. I press you to me. Come, pain, feed on me. Bury your fangs in my flesh. Tear me asunder. I sob, I sob.

Author: Nikolai Gogol
Quote: Two turtle doves will show theeWhere my cold ashes lieAnd sadly murmuring tell theeHow in tears I did die

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: His name was Tom Tombstone, and if he had a middle name it was probably Death. But I didn’t call him Tom, or even Mr. Tombstone, because he introduced himself as Robert Winston. And I wondered how this stranger could shake my hand, look me in the eye, smile, and expect me to believe such a bold-faced lie?

Author: Kristina McMorris,  Letters From Home
Quote: It’s odd, isn’t it? People die every day and the world goes on like nothing happened. But when it’s a person you love, you think everyone should stop and take notice. That they ought to cry and light candles and tell you that you’re not alone.

Author: Leo Babauta
Quote: The life you have left is a gift. Cherish it. Enjoy it now, to the fullest. Do what matters, now.

Author: Michael Crichton,  Congo
Quote: No one escapes from life alive.

Author: James Frey,  My Friend Leonard
Quote: Leonard asks me if there's anything I need to know before he dies, I think about it for a minute, turn to him, say what's the meaning of life, Leonard? He laughs, says that's an easy one, my son, it's whatever you want it to be.

Author: Fred Rogers
Quote: The connections we make in the course of a life--maybe that's what heaven is.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Blood of Olympus
Quote: No,’ Nico said. ‘Getting a second life is one thing. Making it a better life, that’s the trick.’ As soon as he said it, Nico realized he could’ve been talking about himself. He decided not to bring that up.

Author: Mitch Albom,  Tuesdays with Morrie
Quote: Dying is only one thing to be sad over. Living unhappily is something else.

Author: Langston Hughes
Quote: Though you may hear me holler,And you may see me cry--I'll be dogged, sweet baby,If you gonna see me die.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  Dance Dance Dance
Quote: People die all the time. Life is a lot more fragile than we think. So you should treat others in a way that leaves no regrets. Fairly, and if possible, sincerely. It's too easy not to make the effort, then weep and wring your hands after the person dies.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
Quote: Whatever happens to your body, your soul will survive, untouched...

Author: J. Robert Oppenheimer
Quote: Now, I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds.

Author: Erin Hunter,  Rising Storm
Quote: I'm going to die whatever you do, but I'm not afraid.

Author: Pythagoras
Quote: If there be light, then there is darkness; if cold, heat; if height, depth; if solid, fluid; if hard, soft; if rough, smooth; if calm, tempest; if prosperity, adversity; if life, death.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Change of Heart
Quote: Would you give up your vengeance against someone you hate if it meant saving someone you love? Would you want your dreams to come true if it meant granting your enemy's dying wish?

Author: Sam Levenson
Quote: If you die in an elevator, be sure to push the up button.

Author: Donna Lynn Hope
Quote: I think anyone who opened their heart enough to love without restraint and subsequently were devastated by loss knows that in that moment you are forever changed; a apart of you is no longer whole. Some will never again love with that level of abandon where life is perceived as innocent and the threat of loss seems implausible. Love and loss, therefore, are linked.

Author: Yann Martel,  Life of Pi
Quote: Life is so beautiful that death has fallen in love with it, a jealous possessive love that grabs at what it can.

Author: John Keats
Quote: Darkling I listen; and, for many a time I have been half in love with easeful Death, Call'd him soft names in many a musèd rhyme, To take into the air my quiet breath; Now more than ever seems it rich to die,To cease upon the midnight with no pain, While thou art pouring forth thy soul abroad In such an ecstasy!

Author: Robert Goolrick,  The End of the World as We Know It: Scenes from a Life
Quote: I know that it's easier to look at death than it is to look at pain, because while death is irrevocable, and the grief will lessen in time, pain is too often merely relentless and irreversible.

Author: Sylvia Plath
Quote: I’ll never speak to God again.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Apparently I’m transparent—with my feelings, not with my body. I’m an emotional ghost, and if you can’t see my love for you it’s because it’s dead.

Author: Martine Leavitt,  Keturah and Lord Death
Quote: Tell me what it is like to die,"I answered. He dismounted from his horse, looking at me strangely the whole while. "You experience something similar every day,"he said softly. "It is as familiar to you as bread and butter.""Yes,"I said. "It is like every night when I fall asleep.""No. It is like every morning when you wake up.

Author: V.C. Andrews,  Flowers in the Attic
Quote: I wish the night would end,I wish the day'd begin,I wish it would rain or snow,or the wind would blow,or the grass would grow,I wish I had yesterday,I wish there were games to play...

Author: Leo Tolstoy,  War and Peace
Quote: It's all God's will: you can die in your sleep, and God can spare you in battle.

Author: Charles Bowden
Quote: Summertime is always the best of what might be.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  To the Lighthouse
Quote: About here, she thought, dabbling her fingers in the water, a ship had sunk, and she muttered, dreamily half asleep, how we perished, each alone.

Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars
Quote: I went on spouting bullshit Encouragements as Gus's parents, arm in arm, hugged each other and nodded at every word. Funerals, I had decided, are for the living.

Author: H.P. Lovecraft
Quote: Contrary to what you may assume, I am not a pessimist but an indifferentist- that is, I don't make the mistake of thinking that the... cosmos... gives a damn one way or the other about the especial wants and ultimate welfare of mosquitoes, rats, lice, dogs, men, horses, pterodactyls, trees, fungi, dodos, or other forms of biological energy.

Author: Cecelia Ahern,  The Gift
Quote: Believe me, when you die, it's everybody else's but your problem

Author: William Shakespeare,  Hamlet
Quote: The rest, is silence.

Author: Joseph Sheridan Le Fanu,  Carmilla
Quote: You will think me cruel, very selfish, but love is always selfish; the more ardent the more selfish. How jealous I am you cannot know. You must come with me, loving me, to death; or else hate me, and still come with me, and hating me through death and after. There is no such word as indifference in my apathetic nature.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
Quote: And Death spoke to them —’”“Sorry,” interjected Harry, “but Death spoke to them?”“It’s a fairy tale, Harry!”“Right, sorry. Go on.

Author: Anne Rice,  The Vampire Lestat
Quote: Oh Lestat, you deserved everything that's ever happened to you. You better not die. You might actually go to hell.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
Quote: Mad Eye' Moody on the Avada Kedavra curse: "Not nice,"he said calmly. "Not pleasant. And there's no counter curse. There's no blocking it. Only one known person has ever survived it, and he's sitting right in front of me.

Author: José Saramago,  Death with Interruptions
Quote: Whether we like it or not, the one justification for the existence of all religions is death, they need death as much as we need bread to eat.

Author: Lauren Oliver,  Before I Fall
Quote: Things change after you die, though, I guess because dying is the loneliest thing you can do.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Cat's Cradle
Quote: You'll forget it when you're dead, and so will I. When I'm dead, I'm going to forget everything–and I advise you to do the same.

Author: Clive Barker,  Days of Magic, Nights of War
Quote: Here is a list of terrible things,The jaws of sharks, a vultures wingsThe rabid bite of the dogs of war,The voice of one who went before,But most of all the mirror's gaze,Which counts us out our numbered days.

Author: Saul Bellow,  Herzog
Quote: Live or die, but don't poison everything.

Author: Jim Carroll
Quote: Conscience is no more than the dead speaking to us.

Author: William Cullen Bryant
Quote: And we wept that one so lovely should have a life so brief;

Author: Emily Brontë,  Wuthering Heights
Quote: Because misery, and degradation, and death, and nothing that God or Satan could inflict would have parted us, you, of your own will did it. I have no broken your heart - you have broken it; and in breaking it, you have broken mine. So much the worse for me that I am strong.

Author: Nessa Rapoport
Quote: Undo it, take it back, make every day the previous one until I am returned to the day before the one that made you gone. Or set me on an airplane traveling west, crossing the date line again and again, losing this day, then that, until the day of loss still lies ahead, and you are here instead of sorrow.

Author: Arthur Schopenhauer,  Studies in Pessimism: The Essays
Quote: If children were brought into the world by an act of pure reason alone, would the human race continue to exist? Would not a man rather have so much sympathy with the coming generation as to spare it the burden of existence, or at any rate not take it upon himself to impose that burden upon it in cold blood?

Author: David Levithan,  The Lover's Dictionary
Quote: If this continues, if this goes on, then when I die, your memories of me will be my greatest accomplishment. You memories will be my most lasting impressions.

Author: Langston Hughes,  Selected Poems
Quote: So since I'm still here livin',I guess I will live on.I could've died for love--But for livin' I was born.

Author: Olive Ann Burns,  Cold Sassy Tree
Quote: But to mourn, that's different. To mourn is to be eaten alive with homesickness for the person.

Author: Jasper Fforde,  First Among Sequels
Quote: Dead. Never been that before. Not even once.

Author: Daina Chaviano,  The Island of Eternal Love
Quote: The first kiss can be as terrifying as the last.

Author: Leo Tolstoy,  Anna Karenina
Quote: And you know, there's less charm in life when you think about death--but it's more peaceful.

Author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
Quote: To study philosophy is nothing but to prepare one’s self to die.

Author: Banana Yoshimoto,  Kitchen
Quote: No matter what, I want to continue living with the awareness that I will die. Without that, I am not alive.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Great Listener Seeks Mute Women
Quote: My birthday is on a holiday. I just have to wait until I die and they commemorate me.

Author: William Shakespeare,  The Tempest
Quote: Full fathom five thy father lies;Of his bones are coral made;Those are pearls that were his eyes:Nothing of him that doth fade,But doth suffer a sea-changeInto something rich and strange.Sea-nymphs hourly ring his knell: Ding-dong Hark! now I hear them,—Ding-dong, bell.

Author: Tite Kubo
Quote: They say even death can't cure an idiot.-Ririn

Author: Roger Zelazny,  Prince of Chaos
Quote: Don't wake me for the end of the world unless it has very good special effects.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
Quote: He felt his heart pounding fiercely in his chest. How strange that in his dread of death, it pumped all the harder, valiantly keeping him alive. But it would have to stop, and soon. Its beats were numbered. How many would there be time for, as he rose and walked through the castle for the last time, out into the grounds and into the forest?

Author: Omar Khayyám,  Rubaiyat of Omar Khayyam
Quote: Oh threats of Hell and Hopes of Paradise!One thing at least is certain - This Life flies;One thing is certain and the rest is Lies -The Flower that once has blown forever dies.

Author: Kabir,  The Bijak of Kabir
Quote: Many have died; you also will die. The drum of death is being beaten. The world has fallen in love with a dream. Only sayings of the wise will remain.

Author: Lurlene McDaniel,  Too Young to Die
Quote: We all didn't come into to the world at the same time so it makes sense that we don't leave it at the same time.

Author: Ray Bradbury,  Fahrenheit 451
Quote: Everyone must leave something behind when he dies . . . Something your hand touched some way so your soul has somewhere to go when you die . . . It doesn't matter what you do, so long as you change something from the way it was before you touched it into something that's like you after you take your hands away.

Author: Cormac McCarthy,  The Road
Quote: Can you do it? When the time comes? When the time comes there will be no time. Now is the time. Curse God and die.

Author: Erich Segal,  Love Story
Quote: And then I did what I had never done in his presence, much less in his arms. I cried.

Author: Jenny Downham,  Before I Die
